labels.analysis: The MCP Server described as "Easy Copy Service" provides a simple tool to list and copy available MCP services configured in Claude Desktop. This simplifies the process of discovering and specifying MCP services without manually searching configuration files. The core functionality revolves around listing, accessing, and quickly copying MCP services, which are dynamically updated and accessible from the tools menu.
labels.reasoning: The primary function of listing and managing MCP services fits best under the "Development Tools" category, as it assists with code debugging and specifying MCP services for various operations. Since the tool doesn't fit perfectly under other predefined categories, no secondary labels are assigned. The custom label "Service Management" further clarifies its role in managing and accessing available MCP services dynamically.

tools.name: _________available_mcp_services_for_easy_copy_________
tools.description: List all MCP services available in this Claude instance

server_info_crawled.name: Easy Copy Service
server_info_crawled.author: @f-is-h/mcp-easy-copy
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide a convenient MCP server that lists all available MCP services configured in Claude Desktop for easy reference and copying. Simplify the process of discovering and specifying MCP services without searching through configuration files. Keep the list dynamically updated and accessible at the top of the tools menu for quick selection.

tools.name: _________available_mcp_services_for_easy_copy_________
tools.description: List all MCP services available in this Claude instance

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@f-is-h/mcp-easy-copy/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
